Authors: Joel Hamilton Nitta, Saad Amer, Charles C Davis
Title:
Microsorum × tohieaense (Polypodiaceae), a new hybrid fern
species from French Polynesia, with implications for the taxonomy of
Microsorum
Abstract:
A new hybrid species of microsoroid fern, Microsorum ×
tohieaense (Microsorum commutatum × Microsorum membranifolium) from
Moorea, French Polynesia is described based on morphology and molecular
phylogenetic analysis. Microsorum × tohieaense can be distinguished from
other French Polynesian Microsorum by the combination of sori
distributed more or less in a single line between the costae and margins
and sweet smell. Genetic evidence is also presented for the first time
supporting the hybrid origin of Microsorum × maximum (Microsorum grossum
× Microsorum punctatum), and possibly indicating a hybrid origin of
Hawaiian endemic Microsorum spectrum. The implications of hybridization
for the taxonomy of microsoroid ferns is discussed.
